revised_title: Torsion of Elastic Solids: Second-order Effects in Deformation
tldr: This article presents a systematic theory of successive approximations for both compressible and incompressible bodies in the context of elasticity. The authors focus on second-order effects in the deformation of elastic bodies, using tensor notation. They apply the theory to the problem of torsion in solids of revolution, specifically considering a cone made of incompressible material.
